question:
how to make DIY muffin liners

Choices:
A: Place the baking paper into an empty tray cup, then place the bottom of your glass outside the food processor. Twist it to mould the paper into place, then repeat with the other tray cups.
B: Place the baking paper into an empty tray cup, then place the bottom of your glass inside. Twist it to mould the paper into place, then repeat with the other tray cups.
steps: To make DIY muffin liners, you need to shape baking paper into the cups of a muffin tray.
A method to do this is by using a glass to help mold the paper.
By placing the baking paper into an empty tray cup first, it will take on the general shape of the muffin cup.
The next step involves using the glass to press and shape the paper more precisely.
Placing the bottom of the glass inside the tray cup allows you to use the glass to press down and twist, ensuring the paper fits snugly into the cup shape.
Doing this with each tray cup ensures you have uniform and properly shaped muffin liners.

Therefore, step B correctly describes this process: "Place the baking paper into an empty tray cup, then place the bottom of your glass inside. Twist it to mould the paper into place, then repeat with the other tray cups."
